title: What should the UK government spend less on? - Quora

response.answer_text: Social welfare - by the expedirent of reducing the huge amount of fraud that is going on (£3.4-£4.6Bn per year). International Aid - we are too generous, far more so that the US (per head of population). Much aid goes to countries that either misappropriate it or don’t need it (India runs a space programme and funds nuclear weapons).

Propping the banks up. Help to buy. FFL Help to buy ISA Deposit loans etc. All these things do is increase house prices artificially and lock out an entire generation from homeownership and thus security of home ownership.
